alert.note: Alert for Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Noatak Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 21 at 3:26PM AKDT until October 23 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...Noatak Valley and Kivalina and Red Dog Dock. * WHEN...Until 4 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop tonight, with blowing snow and low visibility developing on Sunday. Snow will become mixed with rain along the coast Sunday afternoon. The heaviest snow will be above 1000 ft. South winds will increase Sunday night and Monday with gusts to 40 mph. Areas above 1000 feet will have low visibility in blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Noatak Valley
